CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A4 reads: "Bethel Rising - This is a progress picture of the building of the new Bethel AME Church at the corner of Morgan St. and Webster Ave., which is rising skyward. According to the pastor, the Rev. J.G. Harris, this massive church edifice is scheduled to be completed by April, 1959, at an estimated cost of $250,000.  The Bethel congregation, which was displaced by the Pittsburgh redevelopment program, is holding worship services at Ethan Temple Church, east Sunday during the interim. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Framed building construction of the new Bethel AME Church, with two small children in foreground, corner of Morgan Street and Webster Avenue
